content.title: Cultural Function And Production Grant Scheme
content.details: The scheme covers all ‘not-for-profit’ organizations for supporting Seminars, Conference, Research, Workshops, Festivals, Exhibitions, Symposia, Drama-Theatre, Music, etc., and small research projects on different aspects of Indian Culture.
benefits: The grant for specific projects shall be restricted to 75% of the expenditure, subject to a maximum of ₹5.00 lakhs per project.
In exceptional circumstances, assistance may be increased up to ₹20 Lakhs with the approval of the Hon’ble Minister of Culture.
eligibility: The applicant organizations must have a properly constituted managing body with defined powers, duties, and responsibilities.
Organizations should have been functioning and registered under relevant acts for at least three years.
Organizations must register on the NGO Darpan Portal of NITI Aayog and obtain a Unique ID.
Organizations must have matching resources of at least 25% of the project cost.
Organizations should have the necessary facilities, resources, personnel, and experience for the project.
exclusions: Organizations functioning as religious institutions or as schools/colleges are not eligible.
The scheme is not meant for College/University Festivals.
content.application_process: Offline. Applications must be sent to The Director, North Central Zone Cultural Centre (NCZCC), Allahabad.
documents_required: Constitution of the Organization with appropriate details
Constitution of the Board of Management or Governing Body
Latest Annual Report or similar documents
Statement of income and expenditure for the previous three years
Indemnity Bond in the prescribed proforma
Details of the bank account for electronic transfer
A detailed project report including description, duration, and expenditure details

faqs.question: What is the “Cultural Function and Production Grant” scheme?
faqs.answer: The grant will be provided for conferences, seminars, workshops, festivals, and exhibitions related to cultural heritage.

faqs.question: Which ministry has started the scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Culture, Government of India.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance will be provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The grant is restricted to 75% of the expenditure, up to ₹5.00 lakhs per project.

faqs.question: Which type of organization is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Voluntary organizations or NGOs with a properly constituted managing body.

faqs.question: For what purposes will the financial assistance be given?
faqs.answer: For holding cultural events and conducting surveys or pilot projects on cultural subjects.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to register the organization?
faqs.answer: Yes, organizations must be registered under relevant acts for at least three years.

faqs.question: How will the payment be made to the organizations?
faqs.answer: All payments will be made only through electronic transfers.

faqs.question: Where can an organization find the application form?
faqs.answer: The application form can be downloaded from the official website of the Ministry of Culture.

faqs.question: How can an organization apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applications may be sent to the Director, North Central Zone Cultural Centre (NCZCC).
